p: Structural racism has also played a significant role in the lack of racial diversity in most professions, including conservation ecology and the geosciences. As an example, Dr. Jonathan Hall shared that he is the only Black person with a PhD working on California Condor recovery. Dr. Hall (Mulki 2020, episode 22) is a wildlife ecologist by training with a broad interest in wildlife conservation, human/wildlife interaction, environmental justice, and species movement ecology. In this episode, Dr. Hall went in depth on how structural racism influences his research methodologies and collaboration on recovery of the California Condor.
